title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When attempting to open a file in another editor while it is already opened in one editor, nothing happens. There is no warning or error message displayed.
EB: When attempting to open a file in another editor while it is already opened in one editor, the workbench should display a warning message stating that changes may be overwritten and asking if the user wants to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be shown, indicating that all files should be closed first before opening in another editor.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right click on the java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will pop up with the java file opened. Close it.
3. Go to the Java Perspective and open a java file by simply double clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench.
4. Right click on the java file again and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
Expected result: A warning message should be displayed by the workbench stating that changes may be overwritten and asking if the user wants to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be shown, indicating that all files should be closed first before opening in another editor.
